results.title: How animals eat
results.brief_description: This film explains the concept of how animals are equipped for food-getting in order to survive. Teeth, claws, beak, poison mechanisms, web, and other means are studied.
results.description: This film explains the concept of how animals are equipped for food-getting in order to survive. Teeth, claws, beak, poison mechanisms, web, and other means are studied.

results.title: How animals defend themselves
results.brief_description: Animals protect themselves from attacks by various means: some depend on their speed and agility, others rely on thick shells or hides, or on sharp claws, teeth, and beaks; others again use camouflage and mimicry. As their environment or their enemies change, so by adaptation do animals’ defence mechanisms evolve.

results.title: How animal life begins
results.brief_description: Portrays the ovulation, fertilization and early development of the mammalian egg. Scenes of spermatizoa attacking the ovum, and time-lapse micro-photographs of cell division in the fertilized egg.

results.title: How about you? (TEFC)
results.brief_description: A sex educational film which uses a factual but informal style. Discusses social attitudes towards sexuality and shows the effectiveness of a variety of contraceptive methods (somewhat out of date!). It also discusses women’s issues and the freedom of women to own and control their own body. Please note this film was made in 1972 and pre-dates AIDS.

results.title: How about a break; You can do it
results.creator_credit: Suzanne Baker, Film Australia and Debby Kingsland
results.brief_description: Two short films in one. The first shows the frustration’s faced by an ‘average’ housewife, the second, the benefits of engaging in recreational activities outside the home. Cast includes Max Cullen, Julie Dawson, Kate Whiteley, Beth Whiteley.

results.title: How a Child Grows (Captioned)
results.brief_description: This documentary follows a baby for the first five days of her life in a Sydney hospital. We see the various tests and examinations that the baby undergoes. The medical staff discuss the main concerns of the parents in these first important days: feeding, jaundice and any behaviour by the baby that doesn’t seem absolutely “normal” to the parents. The mother describes her feelings and reactions during these first emotional days with her new baby.

results.title: How a cheque book works
results.creator_credit: Andrew J. Helgeson, Austral Pacific Productions, National Bank of Australia and Raymond Leach
results.brief_description: An animated film in which a young boy’s enquiries about money lead to a lesson on the uses of a cheque book. During a visit to the bank the role of the manager, and other bank services are explained.

results.title: How's it going?
results.brief_description: The four cases that make up this film deal with an important management activity: the interview. They have been designed to permit investigation of basic interviewing principles and techniques for appraising employee performance. Specifically, they serve as a springboard for analysing four goals of both interviewer and interviewee: understanding, agreement, action and learning. Methods for dealing with interview problems. The four cases are: 1. More than paperwork. 2. Give and take. 3. Means to an end. 4. The way ahead.
